alert.note: Alert for Caddo (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 10:28AM CDT until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Cross Bayou At Cross Lake affecting Caddo Parish. For the Lakes...including Cross Lake...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cross Bayou At Cross Lake. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 171.7 feet. - Forecast...The lake will continue to rise to 172.0 feet before cresting this afternoon. The lake will slowly fall over the next few days. Additional rainfall could cause the late to rise again later this week. - Action stage is 172.5 feet. - Flood stage is 173.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1030 AM CDT.
